creator: Kajnjaps
title: The Godot Machine
materials_required: Discrete transistors (Q2, Q3, Q4, Q6, Q7, Q8)
description: The Godot Machine is a solar-powered art piece that aims to capture the feeling of waiting for something that may or may not happen. It uses a Joule Thief circuit to charge capacitors, which then power an Arduino Nano. The Arduino generates a random number and compares it to a stored number. If they match, a green LED and beeper activate, signifying the 'arrival of Godot'. The process repeats until a match is found, which could take years.
steps: Build a Joule Thief circuit to charge 9x2200uF capacitors.
Construct a discrete transistor power switch circuit (Q2, Q3, Q4) to power on at 5.1V and off at 3.0V.
Create an entropy generator (Q6, Q7, Q8) using a guitar string as an antenna to amplify environmental noise.
Connect the output of the power switch (collector of Q4) to the 5V pin of the Arduino Nano (not VIN).
Build the circuit on a perfboard.
Mount the solar panel and circuit board onto plywood for positioning towards the sun.
Program the Arduino Nano using the provided code (godot_machine.ino) to generate random numbers based on a logistic map and seed it with noise from the entropy generator.

The random number generator code measures voltage from the entropy generator on pin A0, shifts bits into a seed value, rescales the seed, calculates the average of the seed and the current state of the logistic map, advances the logistic map, extracts a single bit, and repeats the process.
Wait for the Godot number to be found. The green LED and beeper will activate when the generated random number matches the number stored in the eeprom.
